= can_carry =

== Description ==
Checks if a character can carry a specific number of items. This function tests weight and inventory capacity constraints.

== Syntax ==
 can_carry(unit, item, quantity)

== Parameters ==
; unit : unitptr
: The character to check carrying capacity for
; item : unitptr
: The item to check if the character can carry
; quantity : integer
: The number of items to check (default is 1)

== Return Value ==
: integer
: Returns the number of items the character can carry:
:* 0 - Cannot carry any items
:* 1 - Can carry 1 item
:* 2 - Can carry 2 items
:* n - Can carry n items

== Examples ==
 dilbegin check_carry();
 var
  sword : unitptr;
  can_take : integer;
 code
 {
  :start:
  sword := findunit(self.outside, "sword", FIND_UNIT_SURRO, null);
  can_take := can_carry(self, sword, 1);
  if (can_take == 1)
  {
    sendtext("You can carry the sword.<br/>", self);
  }
  else
  {
    sendtext("You cannot carry the sword.<br/>", self);
  }
 } dilend

 dilbegin weight_check();
 var
  item1 : unitptr;
  item2 : unitptr;
  item3 : unitptr;
  can_take1 : integer;
  can_take2 : integer;
  can_take3 : integer;
 code
 {
  :start:
  item1 := findunit(self.outside, "sword", FIND_UNIT_SURRO, null);
  item2 := findunit(self.outside, "shield", FIND_UNIT_SURRO, null);
  item3 := findunit(self.outside, "armor", FIND_UNIT_SURRO, null);
  
  can_take1 := can_carry(self, item1, 1);
  can_take2 := can_carry(self, item2, 1);
  can_take3 := can_carry(self, item3, 1);
  
  if (can_take1 + can_take2 + can_take3 >= 3)
  {
    sendtext("You can carry all three items.<br/>", self);
  }
  else
  {
    sendtext("You cannot carry all three items.<br/>", self);
  }
 } dilend

 dilbegin inventory_limit();
 var
  max_items : integer;
  current_capacity : integer;
 code
 {
  :start:
  max_items := 10;
  current_capacity := capacity(self);
  sendtext("You can carry " + itoa(max_items) + " items.<br/>", self);
  sendtext("Your current capacity allows " + itoa(current_capacity) + " items.<br/>", self);
 } dilend

== Notes ==
* The function considers both weight and quantity constraints
* Weight limits are based on the character's strength and dexterity
* Quantity limits may be affected by character level or other factors
* Returns 0 if the character cannot carry any of the specified items
* Returns the actual number of items that can be carried (may be less than requested)
* Commonly used for item pickup validation, inventory management, and encumbrance checks
* The function does not actually give items to the character - it only checks capacity

== See Also ==
* capacity - For getting the maximum weight a unit can carry
* weight - For getting the current weight of a unit
* fits - For checking if an item fits in a specific slot
